alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:29PM EST until January 11 at 9:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New York NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Quinebaug River near Jewett City affecting New London County. For the Quinebaug...including Jewett City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Quinebaug River near Jewett City. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Norman Road and banjo Sullivan Road are closed with water covering the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.5 ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 10/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Quinebaug River Jewett City 17.5 16.2 Wed 1 pm EST 17.3 13.6 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
